title: Archiving emails to make inbox smaller
content: Sorry I'm not making myself clear. I want to save the emails to where I can access them if needed later. After I have that I want to delete the older emails in Gmail to make the inbox and folders smaller. Thunderbird will then sync the inbox which will be considerably smaller. It appears that archiving will do this but I don't know how to copy the emails to Local Folders. It appears that Thunderbird will still be able to search & find the old emails if I need them. After deleting them, Thunderbird will be syncing the smaller inbox instead of all of them. I copied the Profiles directory from the appdata string to an external drive which it appears I have backed the profile up.
creator: bertnuc

title: Email sent by mistake
content:
質問お願い致します。 先程、誤ってメールを送信してしまいました。 受信側のメールも削除したいのです。 申し訳ありません。 回答よろしくお願い致します。


Please ask any questions. I sent an email by mistake earlier. I also want to delete the email on the receiving side. very sorry. Thank you for your reply.
creator: mangasouko.jyunya

title: Thunderbird 128 oauth fails with gmail
content:
I have Thunderbird 128 installed and just tried to get my gmail account set up. Everytime I try to add it, the Oauth window comes up, I log into Google, and then get a "malformed url" error and the oauth fails.

Anyone else have this problem with 128? Is there a workaround?
creator: bob364

title: Inserting links in Thunderbird
content: In a mass email, I want to use a portion of a large graphic (.jpg) as a link to a web page. I do realize that I can use an individual graphic as a link, but is there any way to specify a region, defined by pixel row/column, to be used as a link? Thank you.
creator: doug.rice

title: new Microsoft secondary authentication requirement
content:
Microsoft sent me this: Various non-Microsoft applications will have their own steps for connecting to your Outlook.com email account using modern authentication methods. See our help article - Modern Authentication Methods now needed to continue syncing Outlook Email in non-Microsoft email apps. However, you may need to contact the creators of those applications to provide you with instructions. In many cases, simply removing and re-adding your account with the latest version of that application will configure it to use modern authentication methods.

Will Thunderbird continue to link me to Outlook? If so, how?

Thank you.
creator: sbz111

title: Unable to send emails with 128.0esr
content: When attempting to send emails from any of my email account using 128.0esr - after pushing send, the email to be sent just sits there and never goes anywhere. I know that all the settings are correct for my email client since they worked fine with 115 (wish I could get back to 115.12).
creator: geo-mech

title: Thunderbird keeps giving me an error message when putting in my password
content: bold textI get an error when putting in my password. It accepts my primary password but not the other password so I cannot get any emails.
creator: bmatt13
